name: chocolate chip cookies
ingredients: 1 cup butter, 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon baking soda
instructions: preheat oven to 350 degrees. Then Cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and nuts. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.

name: meatloaf
ingredients: 1.5 pounds ground beef, 1 egg, 1 onion chopped, 1 cup milk, 1 cup dried bread crumbs, salt and pepper, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 tablespoons prepared mustard
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the beef, egg, onion, milk and bread OR cracker crumbs. Season with salt and pepper to taste and place in a lightly greased 9x5-inch loaf pan, or form into a loaf and place in a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish. In a separate small bowl, combine the brown sugar, mustard and ketchup. Mix well and pour over the meatloaf.

name: tiramisu
ingredients: 6 large egg yolks, 1 cup (200g) sugar, divided, 3 ounces (6 tablespoons) dark rum, divided, 1 1/2 cups (12 ounces) mascarpone cheese, cold from the fridge, 1 cup heavy cream, cold from the fridge, 1 cup boiling water, 1 tablespoon instant espresso powder, 1 (7-ounce) package ladyfingers, Unsweetened cocoa powder (not Dutch-processed) for dusting the top
instructions: Prep the dish: Lightly oil an 8x8-inch baking dish. Whisk the yolks and sugar to make the zabaglione. Add in the rum: Gradually whisk in 2 ounces (4 tablespoons) of the rum and continue whisking rapidly over the double boiler for about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick, foamy, and very pale yellow. Whip the mascarpone and cream. Mix the whipped cream and the zabaglione: Fold 1/3 of the whipped cream into the zabaglione to lighten it, then fold in the remaining whipped cream. Make the coffee dipping liquid for the ladyfingers. Assemble the tiramisu, then chill.
